Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204 - 6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma, and
must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth sustained bruises on four different occasions from being
restrained by staff at the facility. During a recent incident, youth hit
a staff member and the staff member responded by pushing youth
against the wall into a restraint. Youth has a small bruise on the
inside of the left elbow as a result.
Investigation A phone message was left with Complainant on January 5,
2024. Complainant left a message with me on January 12,
2024, and reported they had no further information.
Program Manager was interviewed via telephone on January
8, 2024. Program Manager reported Youth A was not restrained,
Staff 2 isolated Youth A’s hand to get a bolt Youth A was holding.
2

Program Manager stated he read the incident report and did not
have any concerns.
Director, Program Manager, and Staff 1 were interviewed face
to face at the facility on January 11, 2024, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. All individuals stated Staff 2 was not
restraining Youth A, instead using a 1-person escort hold to
prevent Youth A from swallowing the bolt she had in her hand.
Staff 1, who is the trainer for Handle with Care, reported Staff 2
did not utilize the appropriate technique for holding Youth A’s
hands but Staff 2 did the best he could to keep Youth A from
swallowing the bolt in her hand.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
Youth A being upset, walking into the shower area, beating on the
door and metal plate until she was able to get a bolt loosened.
Staff 2 stated Youth A was able to unthread the bolt and due to
Youth A’s history of self-harming and swallowing items he initiated
a Handle with Care one-person escort. Staff 2 reported he was
able to get the bolt from Youth A’s hand and call for staff
assistance. Staff 2 stated Youth A was fighting against him,
kicking him and struck him in the face. Staff 2 described other
staff coming to assist and being able to escort Youth A to her
room with Staff 4’s assistance. Staff 2 stated he was attempting to
hold Youth A’s arms against her body behind her back, but Youth
A was fighting against him so much he was not successful. Staff
2 denied the interaction being a restraint because Youth A did not
go to the floor. Staff 2 described going over Youth A’s shoulders
with his hands/arms and through her arms to escort Youth A.
Staff 2 denied seeing any marks or bruises on Youth A or Youth A
indicate she had marks/bruises.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described
responding to a staff assistance call and seeing Staff 2 and Youth
A in the shower area of the pod with Staff 2 and Staff 4 escorting
Youth A to her room. Staff 3 stated the way Staff 2 and Staff 4
were walking with Youth A to her room looked appropriate and
was the correct escort technique. Staff 3 reported there were
other youth in the pod at the time and he was trying to keep them
away from the situation. Staff 3 stated he spoke with Youth A
after she was in her room and calmed down. Staff 3 reported
Youth A never told him why she unscrewed the bolt but stated
Youth A has a history of swallowing things in order to go to the
hospital. Staff 3 denied seeing any marks or bruises on Youth A
3

after the interaction. Staff 3 stated Youth A always points out
every mark, bruise, rash, spot on her body to staff and she never
said anything to him.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
A reported getting a bolt from one of the doors and Staff 2 tried to
restrain her. Youth A reported she had a mark on her arm from
the restraint. Youth A stated the mark was from Staff 2 elbowing
her on her arm. Youth A stated she was upset and punched Staff
2 in the face. Youth A reported when she gets angry, she tells
staff she wants to call Child Protective Services (CPS). Youth A
reported staff will tell her she has to calm down first then can
make the call. Youth A reported after she is calmed down, she no
longer wants to call CPS and does not ask to make the call.
Youth A denied not being allowed to contact CPS when she is
calm.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
B described her pod as having a lot of behavioral problems with
Youth A lying, not following directions, talking about going to adult
foster care, and sharing her past. Youth B denied hearing Youth
A say she was injured in a restraint. Youth B stated she likes it at
the facility and does not have any concerns with staff.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
C described a lot of youth on her pod as being “dumb and lying
about staff.” Youth C reported she likes most staff at the facility
and does not have any concerns. Youth C stated it is the “safest
place I’ve ever been.”
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse stated she
was not aware of any bruising or marks on Youth A following the
incident with Staff 2. Nurse reported Youth A showed her marks
on her arm and said they were from a restraint, but Nurse stated
the marks were red stretch marks not bruising. Nurse described
the marks being on the inside of Youth A’s upper arm.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on January 18, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described responding
to a staff assistance call and assisting Staff 2 with an escort of
Youth A to her room. Staff 4 stated Youth A was in the shower
area when he arrived at the pod. Staff 4 reported Staff 2 had a
4

“sloppy” hold of Youth A’s hands and was not using the proper
technique for a one-person escort. Staff 4 described a one-
person escort would have been Youth A agreeing to walk with
Staff 2.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 1/03/2024 event between Youth A and Staff 2
was reviewed on 1/11/2024 at the facility with DHHS Worker,
Director, Program Manager and Staff 1 who is the Handle with
Care trainer. The video shows Staff 2 in the shower area of the
pod with Youth A. Staff 2 is observed grabbing Youth A’s hands
trying to hold on to them. Staff 2 is standing behind Youth A, and
his arms are up and over Youth A’s shoulders. Youth A is seen
kicking Staff 2, moving her body back and forth trying to get out of
Staff 2’s hold. It appears Staff 2 is bear hugging Youth A from
behind restricting her movement. Staff 2 is successful in not
allowing Youth A to swallow the bolt, but the technique used by
Staff 2 is not approved.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There were no disciplinary record
and Staff 2 completed the required Handle with Care
training 02/20/2023 – 03/03/2023.
• Incident Report 171200213 for Youth A reads Staff 2
placed Youth A into a Handle with Care one-person escort
hold. Video review and interviews with Youth A and staff
show and described Youth A’s movement being restricted
by Staff 2. Staff 2 used a physical form of wrapping his
arms around Youth A to restrict her arm movement.
• Agency Response Plan put in place on 01/05/2024 and
updated on 01/22/2024 for Youth A to have a follow up
medical appointment for the swelling in her feet and for
Staff 2 to work on a different pod until the investigation is
completed. This plan was signed by Director.
• Handle with Care Behavior Management System Manual:
The technique described by Staff 2 and what was
documented in Incident Report 171200213 is not consistent
with what the video shows or what Handle with Care
teaches.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 2 did not use an
approved Handle with Care technique to restrain Youth A. It is
noted the agency did not consider this to be a restraint.
Technical Assistance:
Multiple staff came to assist Staff 2 with Youth A which can lead to
escalating a situation. It is recommended the facility use a code to
5

provide what level of assistance is needed in a situation, helping
to determine how many staff respond to a situation. Additionally,
as multiple staff arrived, several youth enter the pod during the
time of escalation.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has swelling in their feet and ankles. Youth went to the
doctor around 12/21/23 and the doctor advised that if the swelling
continues, youth will need to return, but youth has not returned
even though the issue persists.
Investigation Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director reported the facility is aware of the swelling in Youth A’s
legs and the nurse monitors the swelling. Director stated Youth A
fills out many medical slips and the nurse sees Youth A for a
variety of things.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
A reported talking with Nurse about her legs being swollen and
Nurse only told her to raise her legs when she is sitting. Youth A
stated she feels Nurse is not doing anything about the swelling.
Youth A reported Nurse took Youth A to the emergency room on
January 8, 2024, to be examined for a possible sinus infection.
Youth A denied talking to the doctor about her legs being swollen
at the time because Youth A was not concerned about the
swelling. Youth A stated she has never been denied seeing
Nurse. Youth A reported her legs were not swollen today.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse reported
she is aware of the swelling in Youth A’s legs and has examined
Youth A several times. Nurse stated she has offered taller socks
to Youth A to wear to help with the swelling and has
recommended she raise her legs up when sitting. Nuse reported
Youth A was seen at the hospital for the swelling in her legs and
the doctor did not make any note of concern. Nurse denied being
aware there was concern Youth A was not receiving care for her
legs.
6

Documents Reviewed:
• Bay Pines Center Health Services Requests dated
12/02/23, 12/04/23, 12/19/23, 12/28/23, 01/04/24 for
swelling in Youth A’s legs. Nurse examined Youth A and
documented “mild swelling, denies pain, instruction on
elevation and tall socks, youth walking without issues, no
indication for ER visit, no change from baseline.”
• St. Francis Hospital report for Youth A dated 12/02/23
reads Youth A presents with concerns of rash and reports
swelling of the ankles. Comments on report are, “mild
erythema bilateral ankles, no significant edema. Unable to
appreciate any significant erythema or swelling noted the
patient’s extremities.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there were five medical slips
for Youth A from 12/2/23 through 01/04/2024 documenting the
swelling in Youth A’s legs being examined and “no change from
baseline” noted. Youth A went to the ER on 1/08/2024 for a sinus
infection and did not mention any issue with the swelling in her
legs.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation Facility did not document physical management used on Youth A
as a restraint.
Investigation Program Manager was interviewed via telephone on January
8, 2024. Program Manager reported Youth A was not restrained,
Staff 2 isolated Youth A’s hand to get the bolt from her hand.
Program Manager stated he read the incident report and did not
have any concerns.
Director, Program Manager, and Staff 1 were interviewed face
to face at the facility on January 11, 2024, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. All individuals stated Staff 2 was not
restraining Youth A, instead using a 1-person escort hold to
prevent Youth A from swallowing the bolt she had in her hand.
Staff 1, who is the trainer for Handle with Care, reported Staff 2
7

did not utilize the appropriate technique for holding Youth A’s
hands but Staff 2 did the best he could.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 1/03/2024 event between Youth A and Staff 2
was reviewed on 1/11/2024 at the facility with DHHS Worker,
Director, Program Manager and Staff 1 who is the Handle with
Care trainer. The video shows Staff 2 in the shower area of the
pod with Youth A. Staff 2 is observed grabbing Youth A’s hands
trying to hold on to them. Staff 2 is standing behind Youth A, and
his arms are up and over Youth A’s shoulders. Youth A is seen
kicking Staff 2, moving her body back and forth trying to get out of
Staff 2’s hold. It appears Staff 2 is bear hugging Youth A from
behind restricting her movement. Staff 2 is successful in not
allowing Youth A to swallow the bolt, but the technique used by
Staff 2 is not approved.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report 171200213 for Youth A reads Staff 2
placed Youth A into a Handle with Care one-person escort
hold. Video review and interviews with Youth A and staff
show and described Youth A’s movement being restricted
by Staff 2. Staff 2 used a physical form of wrapping his
arms around Youth A to restrict her arm movement.
• Bay Pines Restraint Policy states when a restraint occurs
the staff must complete an incident report and notify
parents, guardians, caseworker, attorney and/or guardian
ad litem.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as they did not evaluate the
physical technique used by Staff 2 as restricting Youth A’s
movements to be a physical restraint and did not document it as a
restraint.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
8

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
